TextView.android:text: SUMMER TRAINING: INFORMATION REGARDING NITI AAYOG INTERNSHIP SCHEME (4/6/2023 2:20:12 PM)

Dear Student,
This is to acquaint you with the information that NITI AAYOG offers an internship for Undergraduate / Postgraduate students under NITI Aayog Internship Scheme.
There are multiple internship opportunities being offered, which you can opt for the internships provided under this scheme.
Online application link is open from 1-10 of every month.
For detailed information regarding this scheme, you may visit: https://www.niti.gov.in/internship
For the information regarding the courses, you may visit: https://workforindia.niti.gov.in/intern/PDF/NITI_Internship_Guidelines.pdf
For the information regarding the guidelines, you may visit: https://workforindia.niti.gov.in/intern/PDF/GENERAL%20INFORMATION_INTERNSHIP%20NITI%20SCHEME.pdf
To apply for the same, you may visit: https://workforindia.niti.gov.in/intern/InternshipEntry/PCInternshipEntry.aspx
Please make sure that in order to avail any internship, keep yourself updated with guidelines and deadlines prescribed by the NITI Aayog.
NOTE: This training shall also be considered as Mandatory 4 - 6 weeks summer internship for students of B.Tech (CSE/IT). \n\nUploaded By: Dr. Rajeev Sobti School of Computer Science and Engineering

Registrations for Community Lead 2023 are open (4/4/2023 1:12:04 PM)

Dear Vertos,
Greetings of the day from Google Developer Student Clubs - LPU!
Applications for the role of Google Developer Student Clubs (GDSC) Community Lead are closing on 09th April! So, hurry up and register to have the opportunity to lead a community of tech-minded individuals and help them learn and grow in the field of technology.
As a GDSC Lead, you will receive training and support from Google to help you develop your leadership skills and grow your community. You will also have access to a network of other GDSC leaders from around the world, giving you the opportunity to collaborate and learn from others.
If you have a passion for technology and a desire to make a difference in your community, hop on this golden opportunity.
To apply and know more, navigate to the given link before 09th April - https://s.gdsclpu.live/lead23
If you have any queries or need some clarification regarding the Event, connect with us on Discord to discuss - https://s.gdsclpu.live/discord
Please, do not hesitate to contact us for clarification or additional information.
Also, For any specific queries, Feel free to reach out to us at: gdsc@lpu.co.in
Follow us: https://linktr.ee/gdsclpu
Stay Connected with us for upcoming events! \n Attachment:\n 1 GDSC LPU Community Lead.png\n Uploaded By:\n Dr. Rajeev Sobti\n School of Computer Science and Engineering
Response to the call for Enrollment into Career Services - 2025 graduating batch students (01-Apr-2023) (4/1/2023 5:44:51 PM)

Kind attention: Students expected to graduate in 2025.\n
Upon students' requests, as a special gesture, the UMS has been unblocked for the students who have not responded to the career service registration call.
Further to earlier UMS announcements regarding Enrollment into Career Services - 2025 graduating batch, all concerned students are hereby informed to positively complete their registration (with applicable PEP fee payment) or deny to opt for Enrollment into Career Services - 2025 graduating batch, latest by 14-Apr-2023.
Kindly note that the access to UMS will be blocked w.e.f. 15-Apr-2023 for the 2025 graduating batch students who will neither complete Career Services Registration process nor deny (reject) to opt for Career Services support from the University, latest by 14-Apr-2023.
In case of any queries or for more details, the students may,\n
*** Contact their respective School Career Guidance Cell - Training and Placement Coordinators (TPCs) or\n
*** Log an RMS query in category: Division of Career Services --- Placement --- Career Services Policy Registration\n
